' that keeps me jazzed for` Idol.' It's an unhinged one,'' said Jim Cantiello about the entertaining, unpredictable shenanigans pulled out by Steven Tyler in the first two nights of audition episodes this week. Truth be told, I never realized how much I missed Paula[ Abdul] last year. Steven Tyler 's colorful language, zany metaphors and deafening jangly man-jewelry was just the entertaining wild card the two-night premiere needed to give it a must-see facelift. Jim Cantiello was glad that the new trio, which also includes sole returning judge Randy Jackson, didn't fall into the same old`` mean Simon Cowell '' and`` too-nice Paula'' tropes. proposal intended to incite a panicked response to a phony crisis,'' Bill Lockyer , a Democrat, said during a conference call with reporters organized by the Economic Policy Institute, a Washington, D.C., think tank. Killer bees, space aliens... now it's the invasion of the bankrupt states. The truth is, no state wants to declare bankruptcy, no state needs to declare bankruptcy, and no state would.
